titles.title: Social Security Child's Insurance Benefits Restoration Act of 2003
To amend title II of the Social Security Act to restore child's insurance benefits in the case of children who are 18 through 22 years of age and attend postsecondary schools.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 9/16/2003--Introduced. Social Security Child's Insurance Benefits Restoration Act of 2003 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act to restore child's insurance benefits in the case of children between 18 and 22 years of age who attend postsecondary schools.
